page.title: 08SHROTON BEFORE THE 1939 WAR
page.content: { BEFORE THE SECOND WORLD WAR}THE POPULATION WAS ABOUT 200 AND ALMOST ALL OF THEM WORKED IN THE VILLAGE ON THE FARMS. A FARM NOW EMPLOYING 3 USED TO NEED 32. PEOPLE RARELY WENT OUT OF THE VILLAGE AS THERE WERE SHOPS IN SHROTON PROVIDING ALL THEY NEEDED. CORN WAS GROUND IN ONE OF THE 2 MILLS AND MADE INTO BREAD AT THE BAKERY. THERE WAS ALSO A BUTCHERS, A COBBLERS, A SWEETSHOP AND EVEN A CLAYPIPE SHOP. THERE WERE ONLY ABOUT 3 CARS AND OTHERWISE PEOPLE HAD TO WALK AND RIDE ABOUT. THERE WAS A BLACKSMITH TO SHOE THE HORSES. MOST OF THE CHILDREN ATTENDED THE VILLAGE SCHOOL UNTIL THEY WERE 14. THEY THEN USUALLY FOUND JOBS IN SHROTON, THE BOYS IN AGRICULTURE AND THE GIRLS IN SERVICE IN ONE OF THE BIG HOUSES. THEY WERE USED TO MAKING THEIR OWN ENTERTAINMENT.{SHROTON FAIR IN SEPTEMBER WAS THE EVENT OF THE YEAR
